title: 14 self-test cases fail to be executed when R-FS is installed using the Spack
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
Hello!I meet a question about 14 self-test cases fail to be executed when R-FS is installed using the Spack.
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
[root@centos8 ~]#spack install --keep-stage -v r-fs@1.3.1
[root@centos8 ~]#spack install --keep-stage -v r-testthat@3.0.1
[root@centos8 ~]#spack cd r-fs@1.3.1
[root@centos8 spack-src]#. ../spack-build-env.txt
[root@centos8 spack-src]#spack load r-fs@1.3.1&&spack load r-testthat@3.0.1
[root@centos8 spack-src]#cd tests
[root@centos8 tests]# Rscript testthat.R
== Skipped tests ======================================================================================================================================================================
* On CRAN (1)
* l10n_info()$`UTF-8` is not TRUE (5)
* need elevated permissions to change uid (1)

== Failed tests =======================================================================================================================================================================
-- Failure (test-access.R:14:7): file_access: checks for file read and write ability ---------------------------
file_access("foo/bar", "read") not equal to c(`foo/bar` = FALSE).
1 element mismatch
-- Failure (test-access.R:15:7): file_access: checks for file read and write ability ---------------------------
file_access("foo/bar", "write") not equal to c(`foo/bar` = FALSE).
1 element mismatch
-- Failure (test-list.R:78:5): dir_ls: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_ls(".", recurse = TRUE)` did not throw an error.
-- Failure (test-list.R:78:5): dir_ls: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_ls(fail = FALSE, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:78:5): dir_ls: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_ls("foo2", fail = FALSE, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:111:5): dir_map: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_map(".", fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not throw an error.
-- Failure (test-list.R:111:5): dir_map: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_map(fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:111:5): dir_map: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_map("foo2", fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:161:5): dir_walk: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_walk(".", fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not throw an error.
-- Failure (test-list.R:161:5): dir_walk: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_walk(fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:161:5): dir_walk: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_walk("foo2", fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:192:5): dir_info: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_info(".", fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not throw an error.
-- Failure (test-list.R:192:5): dir_info: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_info(fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.
-- Failure (test-list.R:192:5): dir_info: warns if fail == FALSE ---------------------------
`dir_info("foo2", fail = FALSE, fun = identity, recurse = TRUE)` did not produce any warnings.

[ FAIL 14 | WARN 0 | SKIP 7 | PASS 674 ]
Error: Test failures
Execution halted
[root@centos8 tests]# vim testthat
[root@centos8 testthat]#vim test-access.R
describe("file_access", {
     it("checks for file read and write ability", {
       skip_on_os(c("windows", "solaris"))
       file_chmod("foo/bar", "-rw")
-      expect_equal(file_access("foo/bar", "read"), c("foo/bar" = FALSE))
-      expect_equal(file_access("foo/bar", "write"), c("foo/bar" = FALSE))
+      expect_equal(file_access("foo/bar", "read"), c("foo/bar" = TRUE))
+      expect_equal(file_access("foo/bar", "write"), c("foo/bar" = TRUE))
 
       file_chmod("foo/bar", "+rw")
       expect_equal(file_access("foo/bar", "read"), c("foo/bar" = TRUE))
[root@centos8 testthat]#vim test-list.R
describe("dir_ls", {
     expect_error(dir_ls(NA), class = "invalid_argument")
   })
   it("warns if fail == FALSE", {
-    skip_on_os("windows")
+    skip_on_os("linux")
     with_dir_tree(list(
         "foo",
         "foo2/bar/baz"), {
describe("dir_map", {
   })
 
   it("warns if fail == FALSE", {
-    skip_on_os("windows")
+    skip_on_os("linux")
     with_dir_tree(list(
         "foo",
         "foo2/bar/baz"), {
describe("dir_walk", {
   })
 
   it("warns if fail == FALSE", {
-    skip_on_os("windows")
+    skip_on_os("linux")
     with_dir_tree(list(
         "foo",
         "foo2/bar/baz"), {
describe("dir_info", {

   it("warns if fail == FALSE", {

         "foo",

● On CRAN (1)
● On Linux (4)

[ FAIL 0 | WARN 0 | SKIP 6 | PASS 3341 ]
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack --debug --stacktrace <command>
```
Although the problem has been solved, I don't know whether this solution is feasible. If you have a better solution, please provide us.
### Information on your system
[root@centos8 testthat]# spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-1044-d577b6fcdf
* **Python:** 3.8.7
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-aarch64
* **Concretizer:** original
